author: Staff Reporter
text:
Members of Joint Action Council – Madurai Kamaraj University (JAC-MKU), a coalition of four teaching and non-teaching associations of MKU, staged a picketing protest in front of the administrative block of the university demanding immediate action on a number of long-pending demands.

As the two Convenor’s Committee members — M. Ramakrishnan and V. Venkatraman — left the university premises without hearing the demands of protesters, the members gheraoed the Registrar’s office following which the CC members came back to negotiate.

The key demands included revocation of punitive action taken against faculty members V. Vasu, S. Ravikumar and M. Parthasarathy during the tenure of former Vice-Chancellor Kalyani Mathivanan. JAC-MKU also demanded cancellation of the dismissal of two students.

Other demands included the time-bound routine promotions of administrative staff without delay, sanction of Academic Grade Pay to Assistant Professors, constitution of an internal inquiry committee to go into the guest house fire accident that took place in December 2015. It urged the Registrar to write to the Deputy Inspector General of Police (Madurai Range) requesting change of personnel investigating the fire accident as the Madurai district police were yet to crack the case.

A letter highlighting the demands had been sent to Higher Education Secretary Apoorva, an office-bearer of JAC-MKU said.

While agreeing to consider some of the urgent demands, the office-bearer said that the CC members had called for a meeting with JAC-MKU on Wednesday.
title: JAC-MKU stages protest
